question: You are a coding expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for display. Create a comprehensive data dashboard for the armored transport industry, including visualizations and data presentation. Output in HTML format, ensuring the file is executable.

checklist.title: Dashboard layout and structure implementation
checklist.description: Review whether the dashboard has a well-structured layout with proper organization of key components (header, sidebar, content area, footer) and responsive design. Check for a grid system implementation that adapts to different screen sizes. Score 0 if there's no clear structure, 5 if basic layout exists but isn't responsive, and 10 if the dashboard has a professional, responsive layout with proper component hierarchy.

checklist.title: Data visualization quality and variety
checklist.description: Evaluate the implemented visualizations for the armored transport industry. Check for diverse chart types (line charts, bar charts, maps for route tracking, etc.) appropriate for displaying relevant metrics like security incidents, delivery times, and vehicle status. Assess whether D3.js or other libraries are used effectively. Deduct 3 points for each missing essential visualization type, and 5 points if visualizations aren't interactive. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Industry-specific KPI implementation
checklist.description: Check whether the dashboard displays armored transport industry-specific KPIs such as on-time delivery rate, security breach incidents, vehicle fleet status, route efficiency, and money handling accuracy. Verify if the metrics are calculated correctly and displayed prominently with proper visual hierarchy. Deduct 2 points for each missing critical KPI and 5 points if the calculation logic is flawed or absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Data filtering and interactivity features
checklist.description: Assess whether the dashboard provides interactive elements for data exploration, including date range selectors, vehicle/route filters, and drill-down capabilities for detailed analysis. Check for proper implementation of dynamic updates when filters change. Deduct 3 points if filter controls are missing, 3 points if the filters don't affect visualization updates, and 4 points if there's no drill-down functionality. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing data, API failures, browser compatibility issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time alerts for security incidents 2. Predictive analytics for route optimization 3. Interactive map with vehicle tracking 4. Custom reporting tools). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple filtering mechanisms that accomplish the same task) 2. Function modules unrelated to armored transport industry (e.g., irrelevant visualizations) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that slow down the dashboard). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data processing/visualization/user interaction layers), code reusability for visualization components, and efficient data handling. Deduct 5 points if global variable pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no data caching or optimization for large datasets. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching suitable for data visualization (no more than 3 primary colors, with appropriate use of alarm colors for critical metrics) 2) Proper layout spacing (dashboard elements follow consistent grid spacing) 3) Professional typography system (clear hierarchy in headings and metrics). Deduct 3 points for each cluttered dashboard section, 5 points for poor color choices that hinder data interpretation, and 5 points for inconsistent visual design across components. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dashboard interactions conform to user expectations: 1) Chart tooltips appear within 100ms 2) Filter changes update visualizations within 500ms 3) Smooth transitions between different dashboard views. Deduct 5 points for each interaction without visual feedback, 3 points for jerky or laggy transitions, and 5 points for confusing navigation between dashboard sections. The full score is 10 points.
